dublinCore.dc:title: HR 662 ENR: Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2011
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.congress: One Hundred Twelfth Congress of the United States of America
form.enrolled-dateline: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Wednesday, the fifth day of January, two thousand and eleven
form.official-title: To provide an extension of Federal-aid highway, highway safety, motor carrier safety, transit, and other programs funded out of the Highway Trust Fund pending enactment of a multiyear law reauthorizing such programs.

subsection.text: This Act may be cited as the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2011.

The Secretary of Transportation shall reduce the amount apportioned or allocated for a program, project, or activity under this Act in fiscal year 2011 by amounts apportioned or allocated pursuant to the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2010 and the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2010, Part II for the period beginning on October 1, 2010, and ending on March 4, 2011.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1. Short title; reconciliation of funds.
Sec. 101. Extension of Federal-aid highway programs.
Title II—Extension of Highway Safety Programs
Sec. 201. Extension of National Highway Traffic Safety Administration highway safety programs.
Sec. 202. Extension of Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration programs.
Sec. 301. Allocation of funds for planning programs.
Sec. 302. Special rule for urbanized area formula grants.
Sec. 303. Allocating amounts for capital investment grants.
Sec. 304. Apportionment of formula grants for other than urbanized areas.
Sec. 305. Apportionment based on fixed guideway factors.

subsection.text: Section 411 of the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2010 (Public Law 111–147; 124 Stat. 78) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking the period beginning on October 1, 2010, and ending on March 4, 2011 each place it appears (except in subsection (c)(2)) and inserting fiscal year 2011; and
in subsection (a) by striking March 4, 2011 and inserting September 30, 2011.

subsection.text: Section 411(b)(2) of the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2010 (124 Stat. 79) is amended by striking 155/365 of.
Section 411(c) of the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2010 (124 Stat. 79) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2)—

subparagraph.text: by striking 155/365 of; and
by striking the period beginning on October 1, 2010, and ending on March 4, 2011, and inserting fiscal year 2011;

paragraph.text: in paragraph (4)—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A)(ii) by striking , except that during such period obligations subject to such limitation shall not exceed 155/365 of the limitation on obligations included in an Act making appropriations for fiscal year 2011; and
in subparagraph (B)(ii)(II) by striking $271,356,164 and inserting $639,000,000; and

paragraph.text: by striking paragraph (5);

in subparagraph (E)—

section.header: Allocating amounts for capital investment grants
section.text: Section 5309(m) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2)—

subparagraph.text: by striking the paragraph heading and inserting Fiscal years 2006 through 2011.—;
in the matter preceding subparagraph (A) by striking 2010, and during the period beginning October 1, 2010, and ending March 4, 2011, and inserting 2011; and
in subparagraph (A)(i) by striking 2010, and $84,931,000 for the period beginning October 1, 2010 and ending March 4, 2011, and inserting 2011;

in subparagraph (C) by striking 2010, and $2,123,000 shall be available for the period beginning October 1, 2010 and ending March 4, 2011, and inserting 2011; and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (7)—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A)—

clause.text: by striking (A) Ferry boat systems.— and all that follows through (i) Fiscal years 2006 through 2010.—$10,000,000 shall be available in each of fiscal years 2006 through 2010 and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: $10,000,000 shall be available in each of fiscal years 2006 through 2011

clause.text: by redesignating subclauses (I) through (VIII) as clauses (i) through (viii), respectively, and moving the text of such clauses 2 ems to the left; and
by inserting a period at the end of clause (iv) (as so redesignated);

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B)—

clause.text: by striking $5,732,000 for the period beginning October 1, 2010 and ending March 4, 2011; and
by adding after clause (v) the following:

in subparagraph (D) by striking , and not less than $14,863,000 shall be available for the period beginning October 1, 2010 and ending March 4, 2011,; and
in subparagraph (E) by striking , and $1,273,000 shall be available for the period beginning October 1, 2010 and ending March 4, 2011,.

subsection.text: Section 5338(c)(6) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: $2,000,000,000 for fiscal year 2011.

subsection.text: Section 5338(d) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1)—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A) by striking $29,619,000 for the period beginning October 1, 2010 and ending March 4, 2011, and inserting $69,750,000 for fiscal year 2011; and
in subparagraph (A) by striking fiscal year 2009 and inserting each of fiscal years 2009, 2010, and 2011;

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2)(A)—

subparagraph.text: in clauses (i), (ii), and (iii) by striking 2009 and inserting 2011; and
in clauses (v), (vi), (vii), and (viii) by striking and 2009 and inserting through 2011; and

paragraph.text: by striking paragraph (3) and inserting the following:

If the Secretary determines that a project or activity described in paragraph (2) received sufficient funds in fiscal year 2010, or a previous fiscal year, to carry out the purpose for which the project or activity was authorized, the Secretary may not allocate any amounts under paragraph (2) for the project or activity for fiscal year 2011, or any subsequent fiscal year.

subsection.text: Section 5338(e)(6) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: $98,911,000 for fiscal year 2011.

paragraph.text: $10,507,752,000 for fiscal year 2011, of which not more than $8,360,565,000 shall be from the Mass Transit Account.

subsection.header: Project authorizations for new fixed guideway capital projects

subsection.header: Allocations for national research and technology programs
subsection.text: Section 3046 of SAFETEA–LU (49 U.S.C. 5338 note; 119 Stat. 1706) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b) by striking or period; and
by striking subsection (c) and inserting the following:

subsection.text: The Secretary shall allocate amounts appropriated pursuant to section 5338(d) of title 49, United States Code, for national research and technology programs under sections 5312, 5314, and 5322 of such title for fiscal years 2010 and 2011, in amounts equal to the amounts allocated for fiscal year 2009 under each of paragraphs (2), (3), (5), and (8) through (25) of subsection (a).
Section 8003(a) of SAFETEA–LU (2 U.S.C. 901 note; 119 Stat. 1917) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking and at the end of paragraph (5);
by striking the period at the end of paragraph (6) and inserting ; and; and
by striking paragraph (7) and inserting the following:

subsection.text: Section 8003(b) of SAFETEA–LU (2 U.S.C. 901 note; 119 Stat. 1917) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking and at the end of paragraph (5);
by striking the period at the end of paragraph (6) and inserting ; and; and
by striking paragraph (7) and inserting the following:

subsection.text: Section 9503 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking March 5, 2011 in subsections (b)(6)(B) and (c)(1) and inserting October 1, 2011;
by striking the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2010, Part II in subsections (c)(1) and (e)(3) and inserting the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2011; and
by striking March 5, 2011 in subsection (e)(3) and inserting October 1, 2011.

subsection.header: Sport Fish Restoration and Boating Trust Fund
subsection.text: Section 9504 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2010, Part II each place it appears in subsection (b)(2) and inserting Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2011; and
by striking March 5, 2011 in subsection (d)(2) and inserting October 1, 2011.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect on March 4, 2011.

attestation-group.role: Speaker of the House of Representatives.
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate.
